alert.note: Alert for Garland; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 4:22PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garland and west central Saline Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mountain Pine, or 7 miles northwest of Hot Springs, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Village... Mountain Pine... Hot Springs National Park... Lake Ouachita State Park... Gulpha Gorge... Mountain Valley... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Arkansas.
